subject: Re: [junit] debuggers
msgSnippet: ... It is true that a good set of unit tests can pinpoint problems in much quicker than a debugger.  However, for less than obvious bugs, it is helpful to
messageBody:
steven.hale@... writes:
> Does junit make debuggers obsolete? Are there situations where
> junit in partnership with logging isn't sufficient?

It is true that a good set of unit tests can pinpoint problems in much
quicker than a debugger. However, for less than obvious bugs, it is
helpful to trace through the code either mentally or with the aid of a
debugger. Also, unit tests will most likely only tell what doesn't
work, not why it's not working.

--Peter
